intro: Dinteracanthus acetabulus, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
